title: Beirut explosion: Palestinian rescuers behind rescue of man from rubble
description: The world was hoping for at least some positive news from Lebanon the day after the explosions rocked Beirut and killed more than 150 of its people.

title: Downtown Beirut Church Hit By Blast Is A Symbol Of Hope, Unity And Grit
description: Like the rest of Beirut’s afflicted buildings, alleys and neighborhoods, St. Elias Cathedral – standing at the heart of the city’s downtown – was severely damaged from the Aug. 4 blast of ammonium nitrate in a port that destroyed a 20-kilometer area, including hundreds of thousands of homes, injured thousands and killed more than 200 people.

title: Countering Islamophobia With Community: A Lebanese Woman's Spiritual Retreat In France
description: This time two years ago, I traveled all the way from Beirut to a small village in France to spend one month as a volunteer at Taizé Community.

title: Sextortion in Syria: Young women support each other
description: Like most girls her age, 19-year-old Nour was blinded by love for her boyfriend. For six months, Nour felt she was living a fairy tale until he asked her for nude pictures.

title: In the age of social distancing, Sudanese open their homes to Ethiopian refugees
description: Residents of border town Hamdiyet are hosting people fleeing the Tigray conflict

title: Gaza’s vicious circle of war, truce, and reconstruction
description: In order to avoid being hit again, Alaa Shamali made sure the new apartment he and his family moved to after their home was destroyed in the 2014 Israeli offensive wasn’t close to Gaza’s border fence with Israel.

title: Reeling it in: Egypt's fishermen exchange the Nile's plastic waste for cash
description: Fishermen use their boats and river knowledge to help collect tonnes of plastic waste choking Egypt's lifeline

title: In Egypt, online group Qawem saving hundreds of women from sextortion
description: Technology has facilitated the sexual exploitation of thousands of women in Egypt. To save others from the same destiny, a young Egyptian man launched an online group dedicated to confronting extorters.

title: "قاوم".. مبادرة لدعم ومساندة ضحايا الابتزاز الجنسي في مصر
description: مع انتشار قصص سيدات وفتيات مصريات تعرضن لابتزاز جنسي، كثفت مواقع إلكترونية جهودها لفضح المبتزين وتعقبهم، مثل صفحة "قاوم" التي أسسها مدير تسويق مصري ويسعى من خلالها إلى إنقاذ ضحايا الابتزاز الجنسي.

title: Ägypten: Hilfe für Opfer sexueller Erpressung
description: Digitale Medien ermöglichen vieles - auch die unerwünschte Verbreitung intimer Privatfotos. Dadurch sind neue Formen der Kriminalität und sexuellen Erpressung entstanden. Eine Initiative in Ägypten hilft den Opfern.

title: La batalla de Libia por conservar sus bosques
description: Una década de conflicto e inestabilidad en el país nordafricano no solo ha hecho mella en la población, sino también en la naturaleza. ¿Podrán los ecologistas salvar Al-Jabal al-Akhdar, un bosque rodeado de desierto?

title: غابات الجبل الأخضر في ليبيا تصرخ للحفاظ عليها
description: لم تقتصر خسائر سنوات من القتال والفوضى في ليبيا على حصد أرواح الليبيين وتدمير منازلهم، بل امتدت إلى الحياة البرية خاصة غابات الجبل الأخضر التي تعرضت للقطع الجائر. فهل تنجح جهود نشطاء البيئة في حماية التنوع البيولوجي؟

title: Libyens Kampf um den Erhalt seiner Wälder
description: Ein Jahrzehnt voller Konflikte und Unsicherheit in dem nordafrikanischen Land hat nicht nur den Menschen, sondern auch der Natur zugesetzt. Können Umweltschützer den Wald Al-Jabal al-Akhdar in der Wüste retten?

title: Libya's battle to protect its endangered forests
description: A decade of conflict and instability in the North African country has not only taken its toll on people but also on nature. Will environmentalists succeed in protecting Al-Jabal al-Akhdar, a forest surrounded by desert?

title: In Algeria's wildfires blame game, misinformation threatens more lives
description: Conspiracy theories, social media rumours and the killing of a volunteer create an unsettled atmosphere

title: Pandemic creates skating craze in Egypt
description: Lockdown boredom leads thousands to jump on a skateboard or put their rollerblades on

title: Delivering babies in a Nigerian camp: ‘I’ve had to use plastic bags as gloves’
description: After seeing a woman die in childbirth, Liyatu Ayuba stepped in and has now delivered 118 babies in a community cut off from public health services

title: Moroccan voters head to the polls to decide fate of ruling Islamists
description: The moderate Islamist PJD is hoping to win a third term in power

title: First-time voters view Morocco's election with hope
description: Voters old and young told 'The National' they want change, but calls for boycott are gaining strength

title: Lebanese women fight period poverty with eco-friendly alternatives
description: ‘Our menstrual health is at risk because I cannot afford decent period products.’

title: Syrian families struggle to get bread during wheat crisis
description: Qahwa, a mother of eight in eastern Syria, says she has been forced to start baking bread at home to feed her kids due to a severe wheat crisis in the country.

title: Armed with pamphlets: the battle to register women voters in Libya
description: Meet the team that helped to double women's presence on the electoral roll to 1.2 million

title: Egypt’s desertification is ruining fields, cutting crops and displacing farmers
description: Agriculture accounts for 28% of all jobs in Egypt. With temperatures predicted to rise by 2-3% by 2050, many families will lose their livelihoods

title: Climate change is killing Libya’s honey bees
description: Sweltering summers and cold winters as a result of climate change are hurting Libya’s traditional culture of beekeeping, and the production of its much-valued honey

title: Tribal endorsements at the helm of Libya's politics as polls near
description: Despite the postponement of Libya's both presidential and parliamentary elections which many hoped will end a long chapter of civil war, another set of votes were taking place across the country, by Libya’s tribes.

title: From criminal to ‘teacher’: the ex-gangster tackling crime in Nairobi
description: One of the city’s most wanted, Peter Wainaina was given a second chance and used it to turn his life around and help others find different path out of poverty

title: The War in Yemen Spurs Surprising Challenges to Traditional Gender Roles

title: Public fears thwart Algeria’s Covid vaccination drive
description: Millions of doses lie unused amid exaggerated concerns about side effects spread through social media

title: Snow in Libya sparks joy for children off school and adults in search of fun

title: Natural hair wigs give Egypt’s child sufferers new hope on World Cancer Day 2022

title: Death of Rayan, 5, crushes hearts in Morocco
description: Nation stunned after anxiously following massive rescue attempt that lasted five days

title: How Yemeni parents are banding together to keep their kids in school

title: How This Nigerian Book Club is Spreading Joy through Literature

title: Passport control: how Yemeni women won the right to travel without a man’s permission
description: Manal Al-Shar’oubi was one step away from her dream to begin her masters in law abroad. Having secured a scholarship to study in Canada, she was full of excitement as she headed to the immigration office in Taiz, in Yemen’s southwest, to apply for a passport.

title: A mangrove revolution: How Egypt is prioritising climate projects in the run-up to COP27
description: Mangroves, nature’s defenders against beach erosion, used to grow naturally in 28 sites along Egypt’s Red Sea coasts. “Because of human intervention, their spread shrunk to around 500 metres only at each location,” says Dr Oman Ghali

title: Young Nigerians are tackling the stigma of mental health
description: Elizabeth Ita speaks at the 2022 Children's Health Mental Week. Held simultaneously across three southeastern states in Nigeria.

title: How one small Syrian NGO is tackling period poverty, one pad at a time

title: Female-only transport trips for Egypt’s women bring change amidst inequality
description: When Shima Fikry’s husband died in July 2018, the then 37-year-old grieving widow suddenly became the key breadwinner for her three children in her rural hometown of Zagazig, Sharkia governorate, some 82 kilometers to the northeast of Egypt’s capital, Cairo.

title: How One Nigerian State Overcame Vaccine Hesitancy and Eradicated Polio
description: As much of Nigeria struggles to contain a polio outbreak, traditional leaders in Cross River have made sure their local constituents embrace the vaccine.

title: Tanzania is using murder charges to get nomadic Maasai off their homelands

title: Facing an Energy Crisis, a Syrian Engineer Designed Electric Tuk-Tuks
description: The electric-powered tuk-tuks are a hit among university students, many of whom had stopped attending classes due to the exorbitant costs of cabs.

title: Rwanda made the sale of skin whitening products a crime. It's working, but underground market persists
description: Sierra asks to use a pseudonym for fear of being caught by the authorities. The 27-year-old shopkeeper explains that she can't maintain her seven-year skin lightening routine because a ban has made the products unaffordable.

title: ‘A bright life ahead’: Botswana on path to seeing no babies born with HIV
description: Country may be Africa’s first to stop mother-baby transmission as WHO hails ‘groundbreaking’ fall in rates from 40% to 1%
